data.title: Mette Frederiksen
data.meta_description: #72 Mette Frederiksen on the 2023 Power Women - Frederiksen has been Prime Minister of Denmark since June 2019 and the leader of Denmark's center-left
data.text:
Great Chronicler Of Station’s Space Odyssey Backs Saving The ISS

One of the world’s leading chroniclers on the International Space Station’s near-mythical birth in the heavens says the ISS should be saved from a NASA plan to crash it.

Alain Delon, 88, Lion Of French Film, Dies At His Loire Valley Estate

Alain Delon, the actor who epitomized French "cool" in a six-decade film career, died on August 18 at his Loire estate. Here, a look back at his immense legacy.

You Are Likely To Live Longer Than You Think: Day Four Of The 10th ARDD Meeting Featuring Minister Mette Kierkgaard

Day four out of five of the 10th ARDD was full of new revelations. For example we learned that that median lifespan of taurine-treated mice increased by 10 to 12%!

5 Leadership Lessons From The Next Generation

What can the next generation of business leaders teach us? Mette Lykke, Lucrezia Bisignani, Nthabiseng Mosia, Akindele Phillips and Andrea Thomaz share their secrets.

What is Going On With The Danish Mink Gate?

Over 15 millions minks were killed in Denmark to prevent the spreading of Covid-19. Two years later, only one percent of mink breeders in Denmark applied for resuming their business, while mink graves excavations reveals no harm for the environment.

Denmark Scraps Covid-19 Restrictions, But Travelers May Still Need Negative Test

Denmark’s prime minister Mette Frederiksen has announced the end of virtually all Covid-19 measures within the country in what she called a “milestone” moment.

Are Greener Forms Of Flying About To Take Off?

International travel is often held up as a leading source of pollution, but will we be able to fly using more greener technology sooner than we imagine?

Denmark Expands Citizenship Exam With ‘Danish Values’ Test

Denmark has introduced changes to its citizenship exam, designed to test potential new citizens' knowledge and awareness of "Danish values" including free speech, gender equality and the relationship between law and religion.

Denmark Announces Christmas Lockdown As Coronavirus Cases Spike

Denmark’s prime minister Mette Frederiksen has announced a nationwide Christmas lockdown to try and deal with record rates of coronavirus cases.

Coronavirus In Denmark: Face Masks Required On All Public Transit

All public transit users in Denmark will be required to wear a face mask or covering from Saturday, August 22, as the government tries to prevent a second wave of coronavirus infections.

Denmark’s Michelin-Starred Restaurant Noma Turns To Burgers

Copenhagen, Denmark: One of the world’s most famous restaurants has announced a surprising new menu for its reopening after the coronavirus crisis.

The Woman Who Said ‘No’ To Trump

Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen made a power play against the president of the United States.
